com.github.privacystreams.core

Class MultiItemStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.privacystreams.core.Stream
      • com.github.privacystreams.core.MultiItemStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMultiItemStream

    public class MultiItemStream
extends Stream
implements IMultiItemStream
    Created by yuanchun on 28/11/2016. MultiItemStream is one of the essential classes used in PrivacyStreams. Most personal data access/process operation in PrivacyStreams use MultiItemStream as the intermediate. A MultiItemStream is consist of a list of items. The items are produced by MultiItemStreamProvider functions (like LocationUpdatesProvider, CallLogProvider, etc.), transformed by M2MTransformation functions (like filter, reorder, map, etc.), and outputted by ItemsFunction functions (like print, toList, etc.). MultiItemStream producer functions (including MultiItemStreamProvider and M2MTransformation) should make sure the stream is not closed before writing items to it, using: stream.isClosed() MultiItemStream consumer functions (including M2MTransformation and ItemsFunction) should stop reading from MultiItemStream if the stream is ended. If stream.read() returns a null, it means the stream is ended.

                                       TValue fieldValue)

        Specified by:

        fieldValue - the value to compare with the field

      • limit

        public MultiItemStream limit(Function<Item,java.lang.Boolean> predicate)
        Limit the stream by testing a field with a predicate, keep the stream as long as the predicate holds. eg. limit(eq("x", 100)) will keep all items in the stream as long as x field equals to 100, once an item's x value is not equal to 100, the stream stops.
        Specified by:
        limit in interface IMultiItemStream
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to test the field
        Returns:
        The limited stream.

      • limit

        public MultiItemStream limit(int maxCount)
        Limit the stream by checking the count of items, stop the stream if the count of items exceeds the threshold. eg. limit(10) will limit the stream to at most 10 items
        Specified by:
        limit in interface IMultiItemStream
        Parameters:
        maxCount - the threshold of count
        Returns:
        The limited stream.

      • timeout

        public MultiItemStream timeout(long timeoutMilliseconds)
        Limit the stream with a timeout, stop the stream after some time. eg. timeout(Duration.seconds(10)) will limit the stream to at most 10 seconds
        Specified by:
        timeout in interface IMultiItemStream

      • project

        public MultiItemStream project(java.lang.String... fieldsToInclude)
        Project each item by including some fields. Other fields will not appear in collectors, such as list(), foreach(Callback ...). eg. project("name", "email") will only keep the "name" and "email" field in each item
        Specified by:
        project in interface IMultiItemStream
        Parameters:
        fieldsToInclude - the fields to include
        Returns:
        The stream with items after projection
